cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi (50 km) east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest tonight, then north on Tuesday night, curving north-northeast and tracking up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend region, north of Tampa, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL (well south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning along the Florida Keys and the west coast of Florida from Flamingo to the Ochlockonee River (well south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida west coast, across Georgia and the Carolinas, northward to New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible Thursday night into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River and upper Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could bring 1–3 inches, locally higher, Thursday night–Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in rain bands as the storm’s remnants pass nearby
